name: Comic Artists That Made History Quiz | Entertainment | 10 Questions

questions.text: Which artist is credited for the 'photo realistic' style?
questions.explanation:
Neal Adams.

	Adams' work on 'Deadman', 'Batman' and 'the X-men' were considered milestones in comic art.

questions.text: Which of the following artists often wrote, pencilled and inked his own stories?
questions.explanation:
Jim Starlin.

	Starlin has been, for most of his career, an all around creator. He's worked on 'Captain Marvel', 'Warlock' and 'Dreadstar' amongst other titles.

questions.text: Who was the artist who designed the Punisher and his costume?
Who was nicknamed 'The King' of comics?
questions.explanation:
Jack Kirby.

	One of the pillars of the Golden and Silver age, Kirby co-created such characters as 'Captain America', 'Thor', 'Fantastic Four','the X-men' and 'the New Gods' amongst others.

questions.text: The underground comix movement relied greatly on the works of which artist?
questions.explanation:
Robert Crumb.

	Crumb's work includes the classics of 'Fritz the Cat' and 'Mr. Natural'.

questions.text: Which artist drew over 100 issues of the 'Justice League of America' (vol.1)?
Who was the comic artist who made ground-breaking art strides in 'Conan the Barbarian'?
Which of the following comic greats was considered one of the architects of the Silver Age with his revival of the 'Flash'?
Finally, which of the following artists has an award named after him?
questions.explanation:
Will Eisner.

	One of the most important artists of all time, Eisner created the modern graphic novel and has always been a innovator. The Eisner awards are given out every year like the Oscars in movies.
